questions.question: What was the one special thing about Mamad?
questions.answer: He never told a lie

questions.question: How far away did people live who had heard of Mamad's fame?
questions.answer: Twenty days away

questions.question: What did the king do when he heard about Mamad?

options.text: He was not ready to believe it

questions.answer: He was not ready to believe it

questions.question: Where was the king going when he called Mamad the second time?
questions.answer: On a hunt

questions.question: What message did the king tell Mamad to give to the queen?

options.text: The king is going to war

questions.answer: Prepare a big feast

questions.question: What did the king do as soon as Mamad left for the summer palace?
questions.answer: He began to laugh

questions.question: Which foot did the king put in the stirrup in front of Mamad?
questions.answer: Left foot

questions.question: What was the king's actual plan after sending Mamad to the queen?

options.text: To go to the summer palace immediately
To not go anywhere that day
To go on a long journey

questions.answer: To not go anywhere that day

questions.question: What did Mamad tell the queen about the king's arrival?

options.text: The king has changed his mind
Maybe he will come, maybe he won't

questions.answer: Maybe he will come, maybe he won't

questions.question: Why was the king 'taken aback' the next day?

options.text: Because Mamad had not lied to the queen

questions.answer: Because Mamad had not lied to the queen

questions.question: What is the origin of this story?
questions.answer: African folk-tale

questions.question: Which of these words is the opposite of 'always' as per the lesson?
questions.answer: Never

questions.question: What does Mamad say he doesn't know for sure?

options.text: If the king put his right foot in the stirrup

questions.answer: If the king put his right foot in the stirrup

questions.question: What advice did the king give Mamad?

options.text: To be careful because lies can slip out

questions.answer: To be careful because lies can slip out

questions.question: What does the phrase 'kept his eyes open' mean?
questions.answer: Watched carefully

questions.question: Mamad was a ________ man.
questions.answer: Wise

questions.question: What is the opposite of 'truth' found in the text?
questions.answer: Lie

questions.question: The king told Mamad to 'Hurry' to the summer palace. Why?

options.text: To give him less time to think

questions.answer: To give him less time to think

questions.question: What did the queen ask Mamad for?
questions.answer: To tell her for sure

questions.question: The king realized Mamad only spoke what he saw with his own _____.
questions.answer: Eyes

questions.question: What is the past tense of 'choose' as mentioned in the activity?
questions.answer: Chose

questions.question: What is the QR code text shown on page 78?
questions.answer: XGDHVD

questions.question: The king was accompanied by many people when he was going on a ______.
questions.answer: Hunt

questions.question: Which word can be combined with 'body' from the activity?
questions.answer: Every

questions.question: The king was 'taken aback' means he was:
questions.answer: Surprised or shocked

questions.question: What was Mamad's reputation in the kingdom?
questions.answer: Mamad was famous as the man who never lied.

questions.question: Why did Mamad choose his words carefully?
questions.answer: He chose his words carefully to ensure he never told a lie and only spoke what he saw.

questions.question: Did the king believe the stories about Mamad initially?
questions.answer: No, the king was not ready to believe that a man could never tell a lie.

questions.question: What did the king warn Mamad about during their first meeting?
questions.answer: He warned him to be careful because sometimes people don't even know how a lie gets on their tongue.

questions.question: What was the king doing when he called Mamad the second time?
questions.answer: He was just coming out of his palace to go on a hunt.

questions.question: What action did the king take while talking to Mamad near his horse?
questions.answer: He held the horse's mane and put his left foot in the stirrup.

questions.question: What specific command did the king give to Mamad?
questions.answer: He told Mamad to run to the summer palace and tell the queen to prepare a big feast.

questions.question: Why did the king laugh after Mamad left?
questions.answer: He laughed because he planned not to go to the summer palace, making Mamad's message a lie.

questions.question: When did the king actually go to the summer palace?
questions.answer: The king went to the summer palace the next day.

questions.question: What did the king say to the queen when he arrived at the summer palace?
questions.answer: He asked if Mamad told her to prepare a feast and claimed it was a lie.

questions.question: How did Mamad deliver the king's message to the queen?
questions.answer: He said, 'Maybe the king will come here by noon, maybe he won't'.

questions.question: Why couldn't Mamad tell the queen 'for sure' that the king was coming?
questions.answer: He didn't know if the king put his right foot in the stirrup or put his left foot back on the ground after he left.

questions.question: What was the king's reaction to the queen's explanation?
questions.answer: He was taken aback and agreed that Mamad was truly a wise man.

questions.question: What does the lesson say about the difficulty of never lying?
questions.answer: It states that it is not very easy to never tell a lie.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'famous'?
questions.answer: Famous means being very well-known.

questions.question: Identify the opposite of 'foolish' from the text.
questions.answer: The opposite of foolish is 'wise'.

questions.question: Identify the opposite of 'past' from the text.
questions.answer: The opposite of past is 'future'.

questions.question: Identify the opposite of 'tomorrow' from the text.
questions.answer: The opposite of tomorrow is 'yesterday'.

questions.question: What does 'taken aback' mean in the context of the story?
questions.answer: It means to be very surprised or shocked.

questions.question: How did Mamad stay wise according to the text?
questions.answer: He kept his eyes open to what was going on around him and chose his words carefully.

questions.question: What is the past tense form of 'tell'?
questions.answer: The past tense form of tell is 'told'.

questions.question: What is the past tense form of 'keep'?
questions.answer: The past tense form of keep is 'kept'.

questions.question: What is the past tense form of 'become'?
questions.answer: The past tense form of become is 'became'.

questions.question: What is the past tense form of 'walk'?
questions.answer: The past tense form of walk is 'walked'.

questions.question: Give an example of a word formed by adding '-fully' from the activity.
questions.answer: Examples include 'carefully' and 'thoughtfully'.

questions.question: What does 'nothing more, nothing less' signify in the story?
questions.answer: It signifies that Mamad spoke the exact truth without adding or hiding any details.

questions.question: Who was supposed to be included in the big feast?
questions.answer: The feast was for the king, his people, and Mamad.

questions.question: True or False: Mamad saw the king riding his horse.
questions.answer: False (Mamad only saw him putting his foot in the stirrup, not actually riding).

questions.question: True or False: The king told Mamad to be careful.
questions.answer: True.

questions.question: What is the opposite of 'more' in the text?
questions.answer: The opposite of more is 'less'.
